sentence.Network_en: Do not cross the bridge but turn sharp left to go down on to the towpath.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要过桥，向左急转弯开到坡下的纤道上去。

sentence.Network_en: We took Tom for a walk on the towpath.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们带汤姆到拖航道散步.

sentence.Network_en: And most the old towpath remains all the way the to Cumberlandis.
sentence.Network_cn: 大部分古老的拉船路依然保留,一直通到坎伯兰郡.

entry.tran: (旧时马匹沿河岸拉纤时所走的)纤路，曳船道
entry.def: A towpath is a path along the side of a canal or river, which horses used to walk on when they pulled boats.

means.word_mean: 1. a path along a canal or river used by animals towing boats

auth_sentence.content: The River Lee towpath is a rich source for plants with which to dye clothes as well as edible plants, nuts and berries.

auth_sentence.content: William Wordsworh may never have walked along its towpath, but the young South London poet Robert Browning may well have done so.

auth_sentence.content: Down the towpath in the dark, that's an adventure, karate-kicking Cybermen under one particular bridge.
